ranked_diseases.explanation: Chronic oral candidiasis is a hallmark feature of this syndrome, often presenting as one of the first symptoms.
Chronic oral candidiasis can occur due to impaired T-cell immunity, which is a common feature in SCID.
Recurrent fungal infections, including oral candidiasis, are common in this immunodeficiency disorder.
This condition is characterized by persistent or recurrent infections of the skin, nails, and mucous membranes with Candida species, including oral candidiasis.
Though less common, chronic oral candidiasis can occur due to T-cell deficiency associated with this syndrome.
